en_results_raw: Mr. Brunner expected more than just rote memorization from us. He wanted us to understand the significance of these ancient figures, their roles in society, and the impact they had on the world. His lessons were not just about names and dates, but about the essence of human civilization. We learned that behind every name was a story, a life shaped by gods, politics, and personal ambition. Mr. Brunner would often challenge us to think critically, to question the information we were given, and to explore the deeper meanings behind the facts. His teaching style was unconventional, to say the least, but it was effective. By the end of the year, we had not only memorized a vast amount of information but also developed a genuine interest in ancient history. Mr. Brunner's passion for teaching was infectious, and it changed the way we approached learning. We realized that education was not just about passing exams but about becoming lifelong learners, always curious and always seeking to understand the world around us.

es_results_raw: Verás, quiero decir que sí, que molaban los días de competición, esos en que se disfrazaba con una armadura romana y gritaba «¡Adelante!», y nos desafiaba, espada contra tiza, a que corriéramos a la pizarra y nombráramos a todas las personas griegas y romanas que vivieron alguna vez, a sus madres y a los dioses que adoraban. Pero Brunner esperaba que no solo nos limitáramos a recitar nombres, sino que también entendieran el significado detrás de cada uno. A menudo, después de la competición, nos sentábamos en círculo y él nos contaba historias sobre los personajes que habíamos mencionado, iluminando aspectos que ni siquiera habíamos sospechado. Aunque a veces era estricto, siempre había una chispa en sus ojos que hacía que sus lecciones fueran inolvidables. A Brunner le encantaba ver cómo los estudiantes se transformaban, no solo en conocedores de hechos históricos, sino en amantes de la historia. Y aunque ya no está con nosotros, su legado sigue vivo en cada clase que da vida a la historia.

en_results_raw: Mrs. Dodds was a sand castle in a power fan. She exploded into yellow powder, vaporized on the spot, leaving nothing but the smell of salt and something sweet, as if a forgotten lollipop had met its end in the whirlwind. The air tasted metallic, and the ground beneath was left with a fine, powdery residue that seemed to shimmer under the harsh light. Passersby stopped to gawk, their curiosity piqued by the strange occurrence, but no one dared to venture too close, the memory of the sudden, violent end of Mrs. Dodds lingering in the air like a warning.

es_results_raw: Se acercaba la semana de exámenes, y sólo estudié para su asignatura. No había olvidado lo que Brunner me había dicho sobre que aquella era una oportunidad única para demostrar lo que sabía. Sin embargo, no podía evitar sentirme abrumado por la cantidad de material que debía revisar. Pensé en pedir ayuda a mis compañeros, pero no quería parecer débil. Entonces, recordé las palabras de Brunner: "El éxito no depende solo de lo que sabes, sino de cómo lo aplicas". Esa noche, decidí enfocarme en comprender los conceptos más que memorizarlos, y me prometí a mí mismo que no dejaría pasar esta oportunidad de aprender y crecer.

en_first_half: Her name is Sally Jackson and she’s the best person in the world, which just proves my theory that the best people have the rottenest luck. Her own parents died in a plane crash when she was five, and she was raised by an uncle who didn’t care much about her. She wanted to
en_second_half: be a novelist, so she spent high school working to save enough money for a college with a good creative-writing program. Then her uncle got cancer, and she had to quit school her senior year to take care of him. After he died, she was left with no money, no family, and no diploma.
en_results: Sally wanted to become a doctor, but the financial struggles she faced made it nearly impossible. Despite her uncle's neglect, Sally excelled in her studies, earning scholarships that allowed her to attend medical school. Her resilience and determination were unmatched, and she graduated
en_results_raw: Sally wanted to become a doctor, but the financial struggles she faced made it nearly impossible. Despite her uncle's neglect, Sally excelled in her studies, earning scholarships that allowed her to attend medical school. Her resilience and determination were unmatched, and she graduated at the top of her class. Sally's journey was far from easy, but it only fueled her passion to help others. She dedicated her career to pediatric oncology, believing that no child should face the same hardships she did. Sally's story is one of perseverance and compassion, a testament to the strength of the human spirit. Her patients and their families found solace in her presence, and she became a beacon of hope in their darkest moments. Sally's life is a reminder that even in the face of adversity, one can achieve greatness and make a difference in the world.

en_first_half: Outside, nothing but rain and darkness-the kind of empty countryside you get way out on the tip of Long Island. I thought about Mrs. Dodds and the moment
en_second_half: when she’d changed into the thing with pointed teeth and leathery wings. My limbs went numb from delayed shock. She really hadn’t been human. She’d meant to kill me.
en_results: The rain drummed against the window, a steady rhythm that matched my heartbeat. I couldn't shake the feeling that something was amiss, though I wasn't sure what. The
en_results_raw: The rain drummed against the window, a steady rhythm that matched my heartbeat. I couldn't shake the feeling that something was amiss, though I wasn't sure what. The darkness seemed to press in, as if it were alive, waiting. I glanced at the clock; it was nearly midnight. The house was quiet, too quiet. I made my way to the door, my hand trembling as I reached for the handle. The thought of what might be out there in the rain sent a chill down my spine. I hesitated, my mind racing with possibilities. What if it was just my imagination? What if it was something more sinister? The decision was made for me when I heard a faint sound, like a whisper carried on the wind. My heart pounded as I opened the door, stepping into the night, the rain wrapping around me like a cold embrace.

La lluvia golpeaba la ventana con un ritmo constante, y ella se sentía a salvo en su pequeño apartamento. Sin embargo, allí, en medio del desierto, la lluvia parecía eterna y la oscuridad era inmensa, como si el cielo y la tierra se hubieran unido en un abrazo sin fin. Pensó en la señora, en cómo su vida en la ciudad contrastaba con esta soledad salvaje. ¿Qué haría si se quedara atrapada allí? The realization hit me hard, and I felt a cold sweat break out on my forehead as I scrambled to find a way to escape.

en_results_raw: Mr. D paused, his voice trailing off as he seemed lost in a memory. "The second time," he continued softly, "she was young and vibrant, and I was a fool. I couldn't resist her, and the consequences were... devastating. Father found out, and the punishment was worse than the first. I was stripped of my inheritance, and my reputation was ruined. It was a lesson I never forgot, though I still wonder if it was worth it." Mr. D sighed heavily, his eyes distant. "I suppose I deserved it, but that doesn't make it any easier to bear. The guilt lingers, and I can't help but feel that I've failed in some way." The room fell silent, the weight of his confession hanging in the air like a heavy fog.

en_results_raw: In ancient times, it was believed that Mount Olympus was the dwelling place of the Greek pantheon, where Zeus and his siblings ruled with their mighty forces. Legends tell of the assembly of gods meeting atop its peaks to deliberate on the fates of mortals. The myths surrounding this sacred site have captivated storytellers and scholars for millennia, preserving the essence of a civilization that revered the divine. Despite the passage of centuries, Mount Olympus remains a symbol of the enduring power of myth and legend, inspiring poets, artists, and adventurers alike to seek its mysteries.

I wished I could leave a mark, something that would remind me of who I was, but all I had were memories and a name tag. In the end, I decided to write my name on a piece of paper and tape it to the wall, a meager attempt to stake my claim in this temporary space.

Me detuve, escuchando con atención, y entonces lo vi: una pequeña luz que se movía entre los árboles. en_results_raw: The mist swirled more thickly, collecting right in front of me and around the table with the pickled monster-part jars. Suddenly, a low, guttural growl echoed through the room, causing the hairs on the back of my neck to stand on end. My heart raced as I realized I was not alone in this eerie, forgotten corner of the old laboratory. The growl was followed by the sound of heavy footsteps, and I could feel eyes watching me from the shadows. My hand trembled as I reached for the nearest jar, hoping the pickled parts might offer some protection. As I turned the jar, a faint light flickered within, and I knew I had to act fast. The footsteps grew louder, and I could hear the mist swirling even more violently now, as if it too was alive and eager to see what I would do next.

Sentí un escalofrío recorrerme la espalda mientras observaba los tarros con los monstruos descomponiéndose lentamente. No pude evitar preguntarme si alguien más estaba escondido en esa neblina. El olor a vinagre y putrefacción era insoportable, y cada vez que intentaba respirar profundo, el aire parecía atraparse en mi garganta. Decidí que debía salir de allí, pero la niebla era impenetrable, y cada paso que daba parecía llevarme más lejos del lugar que buscaba. Sentí miedo, pero también curiosidad, como si algo importante estuviera a punto de revelarse.

With renewed determination, he began piecing together the fragments, determined to restore what had been lost.

Mientras recogía el resto de mis pertenencias, no podía evitar pensar en lo que podría haber pasado si no hubiera decidido quedármelo. Aunque el cuerno del Minotauro era un recordatorio valioso, también era un recordatorio de lo peligroso que había sido ese viaje. Decidí que debía ser más precavido en el futuro, ya que no sabía cuántas otras pruebas me esperaban.

The journey promised to be an adventure, far from the familiar streets of home.

Anh Argus dặn dò tôi nhớ liên lạc nếu cần bất kỳ sự hỗ trợ nào. Tôi nhìn quanh khu vực, cảm giác một chút bối rối giữa dòng người qua lại. Khi xe buýt sắp khởi hành, tôi vội vàng lên xe, lòng đầy hy vọng và một chút sợ hãi. Tôi biết rằng đây là bước đầu tiên trong hành trình mới của mình, và tôi sẽ cố gắng thích nghi với mọi thứ.

es_results_raw: Argos nos dejó en la estación de autobuses Greyhound del Upper East Side, no muy lejos del apartamento de mi prima, quien nos esperaba con una sonrisa. Había preparado una deliciosa cena para celebrar nuestra llegada, y la atmósfera era acogedora y familiar. Aunque estábamos cansados del viaje, no pudimos evitar sentirnos en casa en ese momento. La ciudad parecía más viva a medida que el sol comenzaba a ponerse, y las luces de neón se encendían en las calles. Mi prima nos mostró algunos de sus lugares favoritos para visitar, y prometimos explorarlos en los días siguientes.

New York'taki bu tatilde çok güzel zaman geçirdik ve herkesle iyi geçirdik.

en_first_half: I thought about how close I was to my old apartment. On a normal day, my mom would be home

en_results: , bustling about the kitchen, preparing dinner or sorting through the mail. The familiar scent of her cooking always
en_results_raw: I thought about how close I was to my old apartment. On a normal day, my mom would be home, bustling about the kitchen, preparing dinner or sorting through the mail. The familiar scent of her cooking always filled the air, a comforting reminder of simpler times. Now, the silence was deafening, a stark contrast to the lively atmosphere that once filled the space. I couldn't help but wonder what she was doing, if she was thinking of me as I stood there, lost in my own thoughts. The distance between us felt vast, yet the memories remained vivid, a bridge connecting the past and present.

en_first_half: “It’s a terrible story,” Aunty Em said. “Not one for children, really. You see, Annabeth, a bad woman was jealous of me, long ago, when I was young. I had a… a boyfriend, you know, and this bad woman was determined to
en_second_half: break us apart. She caused a terrible accident. My sisters stayed by me. They shared my bad fortune as long as they could, but eventually they passed on. They faded away. I alone have survived, but at a price. Such a price.”
en_results: Aunty Em paused, her voice trailing off as she gazed into the distance, lost in the memory. "She was determined to ruin everything," she continued softly. "She spread lies about us, saying the most terrible things. People turned
en_results_raw: Aunty Em paused, her voice trailing off as she gazed into the distance, lost in the memory. "She was determined to ruin everything," she continued softly. "She spread lies about us, saying the most terrible things. People turned against me, and my heart was broken. That's when I realized the importance of being true to yourself. Annabeth, listen carefully, because this is a lesson I learned the hard way. Never let jealousy or hatred dictate your actions. It's a dangerous path, and it can destroy everything you hold dear." Aunty Em's eyes welled up with tears, and she wiped them away with a trembling hand. "That's why I'm telling you this, Annabeth. Life is too short to let others define your happiness."

vi_results: Annabeth giật mình nhớ lại những ngày tháng đầy gian nan ấy. Người đàn bà ghen tức đã tìm mọi cách để làm hại cô, từ việc nói xấu cho đến những âm mưu nguy hiểm. Cô đã phải đối mặt với nhiều thử thách,
vi_results_raw: Annabeth giật mình nhớ lại những ngày tháng đầy gian nan ấy. Người đàn bà ghen tức đã tìm mọi cách để làm hại cô, từ việc nói xấu cho đến những âm mưu nguy hiểm. Cô đã phải đối mặt với nhiều thử thách, nhưng nhờ có tình yêu và sự kiên cường, Annabeth đã vượt qua tất cả. Những kỷ niệm ấy giờ đây chỉ còn là quá khứ, nhưng cô vẫn không thể quên được nỗi đau và sự oán hận mà người đàn bà kia đã gây ra. Annabeth quyết định không để những điều tiêu cực này ảnh hưởng đến cuộc sống hiện tại của mình. Cô tập trung vào những điều tích cực, xây dựng tương lai tốt đẹp và giúp đỡ những người xung quanh. Cuộc sống của cô đã thay đổi hoàn toàn, và những trải nghiệm đó đã giúp cô trưởng thành hơn rất nhiều.
es_first_half: —Es una historia terrible. Desde luego, no es para niños. Verás, Annabeth, hace mucho tiempo, cuando yo era joven, una mala mujer tuvo celos de mí. Yo tenía un novio, ya sabéis, y esa mala mujer estaba

en_results: leaving us stranded in the middle of nowhere. The gods, who had promised to guide us, seemed to have abandoned us. Every step forward felt like
en_results_raw: I was angry, not just with Annabeth or her mom, but with all the gods for this whole quest, for getting us blown off the road and leaving us stranded in the middle of nowhere. The gods, who had promised to guide us, seemed to have abandoned us. Every step forward felt like a betrayal, and I couldn't shake the feeling that we were being punished for something we didn't do. The weight of the situation pressed down on me, making it hard to think clearly. I knew I had to stay focused, but the frustration was building, and I wasn't sure how much longer I could hold it in. The journey ahead seemed endless, and I couldn't help but wonder if we would ever find our way back to safety.

es_results_raw: Me enfadé, no sólo con Annabeth o su madre, sino con todos los dioses por aquella absurda misión, por sacarnos de la carretera con un rayo y por dejarnos atrapados en ese bosque maldito durante una semana. Cada vez que intentaba dormir, veía luces parpadeantes y oía voces que me susurraban secretos antiguos. Los dioses parecían divertirse mientras nosotros sufríamos, y eso fue lo que realmente me hizo enojar. ¿Cómo podían ser tan insensibles? Finalmente, después de una semana, conseguimos salir del bosque, pero el daño ya estaba hecho. Annabeth y yo estábamos más cerca que nunca, pero también más distantes, y no sabía si eso era algo bueno o malo.

en_results_raw: I gritted my teeth, steeling myself for the confrontation. My heart pounded in my chest, but I knew I had to press on. The blade felt cold and reassuring in my hand, a lifeline against the chaos that loomed above. Every step I took seemed to echo through the dimly lit corridor, each sound magnified by the tension that filled the air. I could feel the eyes of the Chimera upon me, though I couldn't see it. My mind raced with possibilities, each more terrifying than the last. Would it strike from the shadows? Or would I finally face it head-on, ending the threat once and for all? The weight of the hilt in my hand grew heavier with each passing second, a silent reminder of the battle that awaited.

El viento soplaba fuerte, y sentí cómo la noche se preparaba para lo que vendría a continuación.

This could be our last stand, but we couldn't give up. Not yet.

en_first_half: Hades raised an eyebrow. When he sat forward in his throne, shadowy faces appeared in the folds of his black robes, faces of torment, as if the garment were stitched of trapped souls from the Fields of Punishment,
en_second_half: trying to get out. The ADHD part of me wondered, off-task, whether the rest of his clothes were made the same way. What horrible things would you have to do in your life to get woven into Hades’s underwear?
en_results: . The air around him seemed to hum with the weight of their suffering, each face a silent scream, a reminder of the eternal torment that awaited those who dared to cross him. His eyes, cold and calculating,
en_results_raw: Hades raised an eyebrow. When he sat forward in his throne, shadowy faces appeared in the folds of his black robes, faces of torment, as if the garment were stitched of trapped souls from the Fields of Punishment. The air around him seemed to hum with the weight of their suffering, each face a silent scream, a reminder of the eternal torment that awaited those who dared to cross him. His eyes, cold and calculating, scanned the room, seeking any sign of rebellion. The shadows danced around him, alive with the energy of the souls they held captive, their whispers a constant reminder of the power he wielded over the Underworld. Hades, lord of the dead, knew that his authority was absolute, and no one dared to challenge it. Yet, beneath the surface, there was a flicker of unease, a subtle shift in the balance of power that even he could not fully comprehend.

vi_results_raw: Hades nhíu mày, cảm nhận được sự căng thẳng trong không khí. Những linh hồn kia, từng khuôn mặt nhăn nheo, dường như đang kêu cứu, nhưng âm thanh của họ bị chặn lại bởi một bức tường âm mưu không thể phá vỡ. Ông ta bước đến gần hơn, từng bước đi chậm rãi, như thể đang tìm kiếm một lời giải nào đó. Áo choàng đen của ông ta, với những hình ảnh ma quái lấp lánh, bắt đầu run rẩy, như phản ứng với sự hiện diện của những linh hồn. Hades cảm thấy một cơn gió lạnh thổi qua, mang theo mùi hôi thối của sự chết chóc. Ông ta dừng lại, nghe thấy một âm thanh khóc thét ẩn nấp sâu trong lớp áo choàng. Đó là tiếng kêu của một linh hồn bị bỏ quên, một người mà không ai nhớ đến, và Hades biết rằng, nếu không làm gì, linh hồn đó sẽ mãi mãi bị giam giữ trong bóng tối. Ông ta quyết định, dù biết rằng hành động của mình có thể dẫn đến những hậu quả nghiêm trọng, nhưng Hades không thể làm ngơ trước nỗi đau của những linh hồn này. Ông ta bắt đầu tìm kiếm cách để giải thoát những linh hồn bị giam giữ, hy vọng rằng hành động này sẽ không làm thay đổi cân bằng của thế giới ngầm.
es_first_half: Hades levantó una ceja. Cuando se inclinó hacia delante, en los pliegues de su túnica aparecieron rostros en sombra, rostros atormentados, como si la prenda estuviera hecha de almas atrapadas en los Campos de Castigo que intentaran escapar.
es_second_half: La parte de mí afectada por el THDA se preguntó, distraída, si el resto de su ropa estaría hecho del mismo modo. ¿Qué cosas horribles había que hacer en la vida para acabar convertido en ropa interior de Hades?
es_results: Continuando la descripción, Hades sintió un escalofrío recorrerle la espalda. La túnica parecía vivir una vida propia, sus rostros en sombra se movían con una lentitud casi imperceptible, como si estuvieran atrapados
es_results_raw: Continuando la descripción, Hades sintió un escalofrío recorrerle la espalda. La túnica parecía vivir una vida propia, sus rostros en sombra se movían con una lentitud casi imperceptible, como si estuvieran atrapados en un eterno susurro. El rey de los infiernos se detuvo, consciente de que cada rostro era una alma perdida, una historia de dolor y sufrimiento que se repetía en la eternidad. Con un gesto, hizo que la túnica se desvaneciera, pero los rostros seguían allí, grabados en su mente. Hades sabía que, en los Campos de Castigo, las almas no solo buscaban escapar, sino que también esperaban, esperaban que alguien las escuchara, que las comprendiera. Y él, como rey de los muertos, era el único que podía escuchar sus susurros, sus plegarias, sus gritos de angustia. Era su carga, su destino, ser el guardián de los secretos eternos de los que nadie quería hablar.

Bu cüppelerin altında ne saklı olduğunu bilen sadece ondu. Hades'in gözleri yorgun ve kara, ancak onun gözlerindeki ışık her an yeniden canlanıyordu. "Ne istiyorsun?" diye sordu, ancak cevap almadı. Sadece sessizce ona baktılar, onun gözlerindeki ışık onları her an yeniden canlandırıyordu. Bu sessizlik, Hades'in içine daha fazla acı ve endişe dolduruyordu. "Ne istiyorsun?" diye tekrar sordu, ancak bu kez sesi daha zayıf ve umutsuzdu. Sanki onun için her şey bitti gibi.

en_results: out. The gods are as fickle as the winds, and their favor is a fleeting thing. I have seen too many rise and fall, too many who once held power now reduced to dust. Yet, I will not
en_results_raw: I can ill afford for word to get out. The gods are as fickle as the winds, and their favor is a fleeting thing. I have seen too many rise and fall, too many who once held power now reduced to dust. Yet, I will not be reduced to that fate. I will find the helm, and I will reclaim what is mine. The depths of the Underworld hold many secrets, and I intend to uncover them all. Until then, I will keep my counsel and my plans close to my chest. Let the gods bicker and fight over petty matters; I have my own battles to wage."

en_results_raw: Poor little Percy Jackson wasn’t an international criminal after all. He’d caused a commotion on that Greyhound bus in New Jersey trying to get away from his captor (and afterward, witnesses would even swear they had seen the leather-clad man on the bus-“Why didn’t I remember him before?”). The crazy man had caused the explosion in the St. Louis Arch. After all, no kid could’ve done that. A concerned waitress in Denver had seen the man threatening his abductees. The case was a media sensation, with tabloids and news outlets speculating about the identity of the mysterious man. The FBI was called in, and they began a thorough investigation, interviewing every passenger on the bus and analyzing the footage from the Denver diner where the waitress had seen the man. As the investigation progressed, it became clear that Percy was not the only one in danger. The man had a network of accomplices, and the stakes were higher than anyone had imagined. The FBI agents worked tirelessly, piecing together the puzzle of the man’s identity and his motives. It was a race against time as they tried to prevent any more attacks. In the end, it was a collective effort that brought the man to justice, and Percy Jackson was finally free from his captor. The ordeal had changed him, and he was determined to use his experiences to help others. The case had left a lasting impact on everyone involved, and it served as a reminder of the importance of vigilance and the power of community in the face of adversity.

es_first_half: Después de todo, el pobrecito Percy Jackson no era un criminal internacional. Había causado un buen revuelo en el autobús Greyhound de Nueva Jersey al intentar escapar de su captor (a posteriori hubo testigos que aseguraron haber visto al hombre vestido de cuero en el autobús: «¿Por qué no lo recordé antes?»). El psicópata había provocado la explosión en el arco de San Luis; ningún chaval habría podido hacer algo así. Una camarera de Denver había visto al hombre amenazar a sus secuestrados delante de su restaurante,
es_second_half: había pedido a un amigo que tomara una foto y lo había notificado a la policía. Al final, el valiente Percy Jackson (empezaba a gustarme aquel chaval) se había hecho con un arma de su captor en Los Ángeles y se había enfrentado a él en la playa. La policía había llegado a tiempo. Pero en la espectacular explosión cinco coches de policía habían resultado destruidos y el secuestrador había huido. No había habido bajas. Percy Jackson y sus dos amigos estaban a salvo bajo custodia policial.

es_results_raw: Después de este incidente, la policía de todo el país se puso en alerta, buscando al psicópata que había causado tanto alboroto. Los testigos continuaban llegando con descripciones contradictorias, lo que dificultaba aún más la búsqueda. Algunos aseguraban que el hombre era alto y de complexión robusta, mientras que otros lo describían como delgado y de estatura media. La policía lanzó un aviso con una foto de Percy Jackson, alegando que era el sospechoso más probable. Sin embargo, la comunidad de fans de la serie de libros de Rick Riordan se rebeló, argumentando que Percy era un héroe y no un criminal. A pesar de las protestas, la búsqueda continuaba, y la ciudad de Denver se llenó de curiosos que querían ver al famoso héroe de primera mano. En medio de la confusión, una camarera de un restaurante cercano al lugar del secuestro reconoció al psicópata en una fotografía. Este descubrimiento llevó a la policía a reevaluar la situación y a buscar nuevas pistas. Mientras tanto, Percy Jackson, que había sido acusado injustamente, se escondía en un refugio secreto, esperando que todo se aclarara. La historia de este incidente no solo había cambiado la vida de Percy, sino que también había sacudido las bases de la seguridad pública en todo el país. A medida que la búsqueda del psicópata continuaba, la comunidad de fans de Percy Jackson se unió para apoyar a su héroe, creando una red de información y vigilancia que ayudó a la policía en la búsqueda. Aunque el caso no había sido resuelto, la historia de Percy Jackson y el psicópata había dejado una huella indeleble en la memoria colectiva de la nación.

Luke nói rằng anh ấy đã thử nghiệm kiếm này trong một buổi tập và cảm thấy rằng nó thực sự có tác động mạnh mẽ. Tuy nhiên, anh ấy cũng nhận ra rằng việc sử dụng kiếm này đòi hỏi sự cẩn trọng và luyện tập nghiêm túc. Tôi hỏi Luke liệu anh ấy có lo lắng về việc sử dụng một loại vũ khí như vậy không, và anh ấy trả lời rằng anh ấy tin rằng chỉ cần kiểm soát tốt, thì không có gì đáng lo ngại. Chúng tôi tiếp tục tập luyện, và tôi không thể không cảm thấy rằng Luke đã tìm ra một cách để kết hợp kiếm ma thuật với kỹ thuật của mình một cách độc đáo. Mặc dù vậy, tôi vẫn không thể không tự hỏi liệu anh ấy có đang đi theo một con đường nguy hiểm không.

tr_results_raw: Mankenlerin başlarını kopardığı için, kılıçta özel bir teknik olduğunu düşündüm. Luke, kılıçın nihai hedefini bulmak için çok daha fazla çaba harcamış gibi görünüyor. Mankenin kafası, arenanın ortasına düşerek, çamurlu yere çarptı. Bu olay, arenada herkesin dikkatini çekmişti. Luke, kılıcını arenanın kenarına bırakınca, kılıçta bir ses duyuldu. Bu ses, kılıçın kendisi miydi yoksa başka bir şey miydi, bilinmiyordu. Bu olaydan sonra, herkes kılıçta bir güç kaynağı olduğunu düşünmeye başladı.

en_results_raw: I was used to hearing from the girls how good-looking Luke was, but at the moment, he looked weary, and angry, and not at all the way they described. His usually bright eyes were now dull, and his usually open smile had been replaced by a tight-lipped frown. There was a tension in his posture that I hadn't noticed before, and it made me wonder what could have happened to change him so drastically. As he walked past me, I caught a glimpse of something in his hand—a crumpled piece of paper that looked like it had been torn from a notebook. My curiosity was piqued, but I knew better than to ask him about it right then. Instead, I waited for an opportunity to talk to him privately, hoping to understand what was going on in his life.

es_results_raw: Estaba acostumbrado a oír decir a las chicas lo guapo que era Luke, pero en aquel instante parecía cansado, enfadado y nada atractivo. Su pelo, desordenado y con mechones en los ojos, no ayudaba en absoluto a mejorar su apariencia. Parecía haber pasado una mala noche, y aunque intentaba sonreír, la expresión de su rostro no invitaba a la confianza. Las chicas que solían rodearlo en la escuela parecían haberse esfumado, y en su lugar, solo había un ambiente de incómodo silencio. Luke notó la mirada inquisitiva de su mejor amigo, quien no parecía convencido de la sonrisa forzada de su amigo. "¿Estás bien?" preguntó el amigo, interrumpiendo el silencio. Luke asintió, aunque su voz tembló ligeramente cuando respondió: "Sí, solo... solo estoy cansado". Sin embargo, su amigo no parecía convencido, y decidió acompañarlo a casa para asegurarse de que realmente estuviera bien.
